intro: Planchonella kaniensis, commonly known as the Kani Island hibiscus, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the island of Kani in the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically eaten raw or used in local traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species with potential ecological and horticultural significance.
